ARABIC: ٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ ضَرَبُوا۟ لَكَ ٱلْأَمْثَٰلَ فَضَلُّوا۟ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَبِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: See how they make comparative judgements about you. They are misguided and cannot find the way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Just see what comparisons they bring up for you! They are lost and cannot find the way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Just see what strange arguments they bring forward with regard to you! They have gone so far astray that they cannot charge any thing against you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Look at their various views about you! They have gone astray and are not able to find the right path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: O dear Prophet (Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) see how they invent examples for you – they have therefore gone astray, unable find a road.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: See how they coin similitudes for you, so they have gone astray, and they cannot find a path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: See what likenesses do they apply to you, so they have gone astray, therefore they shall not be able to find a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Behold, how they strike similitudes for thee, and go astray, and are unable to find a way!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: See how they coin similitudes for thee, so that they are all astray and cannot find a road!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Observe what kind of things they attribute to you. They have surely gone astray and cannot find the right way again.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Behold how they propound similitudes for thee! so they have strayed and cannot find a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Look, how they coin epithets for you; so they go astray, and cannot find the way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: See what kinds of comparisons they make for thee! But they have gone astray, and never a way will they be able to find!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: See how they coin similitudes for you, so they have gone astray, and they cannot find a (Right) Path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: See how they strike examples for you, surely they have gone astray and are unable to find a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Look how they invent examples for you. They have gone astray, and cannot find a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:9] See how they strike similitudes for you, of [the fact that the Prophet is] a person bewitched and one in need of something to expend [from] and of an angel to help him carry out the task [of delivering the Message], so that they go astray, thereby from guidance, and are unable to find a way, a means thereto [to guidance].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (See how they coin similitudes for thee) see how they explain things to you and call you names: magician, fortune teller, liar, poet, and madman; it is also said that this means: see how they liken you to a bewitched person, (so that they are all astray) their scheming went amiss and they fell in error (and cannot find a road) they cannot find a way out of what they said about you, nor do they have any proof about what they say about you!
